newsitem.title: CANADA: TrizecHahn buys stake in New York buildings.
newsitem.headline: TrizecHahn buys stake in New York buildings.

text.p: TrizecHahn Corp said on Monday it bought a 49.9 percent managing interest in three New York office properties for US$210 million.
The portfolio was bought from from the Weiler-Arnow Investment Co. The Swig Investment Co will keep a 50 percent interest in the buildings, the company said.

TrizecHahn said the 2.7 million square foot office portfolio is located in mid-town Manhattan between Times Square and Grand Central Station and includes the 1.4 million square foot, 50-storey Grace Building. Other buildings include the 1.1 million square foot, 41-storey World Apparel Center and 1460 Broadway, a 185,000 square foot, 17-storey building.
TrizecHahn said average occupancy in the portfolio is 97 percent.
